snippet: The mayor of Jersey City opened two locked and apparently long forgotten safes in a move reminiscent of Geraldo Rivera’s look into Al Capone’s vaults.
abstract: Jersey City Mayor Steven Fulop opens two locked and apparently long-forgotten safes in a move reminiscent of Geraldo Rivera’s look into Al Capone’s vaults televised in 1986; it is not the first time safes had been publicly opened in a grand gesture meant to signal a new era; they were opened in 1949 and like now, revealed nothing of import.
lead_paragraph: The mayor of Jersey City opened two locked and apparently long forgotten safes in a move reminiscent of Geraldo Rivera’s look into Al Capone’s vaults.

headline.main: If Wall Safes Could Talk, the Tales of Graft Two Could Tell
headline.print_headline: If Wall Safes Could Talk, the Tales of Graft Two Could Tell
